name: Logic (Argus Specialist Publications)
overview: Published in Commodore Disk User 1989/01-02. You don't have to be Mr Spock to solve this challenge to your intellect. It could help though... Logic is a game that careful thought. The computer will present you with an array of five pegs, each of which can be any one of five colors: red, green, yellow, blue and purple. The problem is that you don't know what colors are used or where they go. Don't despair, because the program will give you a number of tries It will tell you each time how many pegs you have got of the right color in the right place Dy displaying one to four black blocks, plus white blocks to show how many are the right color but are in the wrong place. The menu allows you a options when playing Logic. Besides the five color bars which allow you to place pegs, you can delete the last peg placed by choosing delete, i confirm your choice of pegs by entering Enter. The joystick is used to make all choices.
